Split over two levels, the three suites (52m² / 550ft²) feature a cosy living room on the top floor and a large double bedroom with en suite downstairs. The view is over the lake and the Torres del Paine mountain range. 

As with Standard and Superior, rooms are equipped with safes, hair dryers and telephones and decorated with hand-crafted furniture, locally sourced textiles and uniquely Patagonian details. The bathroom has a separate shower, WC, washbasin and bathtub.

The view from the tub is 'out of this world'.

Standard domes come with comfortable king-size or twin beds and can be booked on a sharing basis. If you are a solo traveller, you can share a dome with another traveller of the same gender. There is no electricity but they now have a radiator to help keep you warm at night. 

Standard domes have shared bathrooms, which are large, comfortable and gender divided. Both male and female bathrooms have showers, with hot water, ample space to dry yourself and put on clothes, composting toilets and hand wash basins. They have little reading lights above the bed but no outlets.
